intro: Oxytropis hindukuschensis, commonly known as the Hindukush oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly the Hindukush and Pamir ranges. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, pea-like flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Oxytropis hindukuschensis is adapted to high altitudes and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
